LOSARTAN POTASSIUM

ANGIOTENSIN-II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Diabetic nephropathy in type 2 diabetes mellitus,

By mouth

  • For adults 18–75 years
    Initially 50 mg once daily for several weeks, then increased if necessary to 100 mg once daily.
  • For adults 76 years and over
    Initially 25 mg once daily.

Chronic heart failure when ACE inhibitors are unsuitable or contra-indicated,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 12.5 mg once daily, increased if tolerated to up to 150 mg once daily, doses to be increased at weekly intervals.

Hypertension,

By mouth

  • For adults 18–75 years
    Initially 50 mg once daily for several weeks, then increased if necessary to 100 mg once daily.
  • For adults 76 years and over
    Initially 25 mg daily.

Hypertension with intravascular volume depletion,

By mouth

  • For adults 18–75 years
    Initially 25 mg once daily for several weeks, then increased if necessary up to 100 mg once daily.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Consider dose reduction in mild to moderate impairment.

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment—no information available.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Vertigo,

uncommon: Angina, dyspnoea, gastro-intestinal disturbances, headache, malaise, oedema, palpitation, pruritus, rash, sleep disorders, urticaria,

rare: Atrial fibrillation, cerebrovascular accident, hepatitis, paraesthesia, syncope,

notKnown: Anaemia, anaphylaxis, arthralgia, cough, depression, erectile dysfunction, Henoch-Schönlein purpura, hyponatraemia, myalgia, pancreatitis, photosensitivity, renal impairment, rhabdomyolysis, thrombocytopenia, tinnitus, vasculitis,

Cautions regarding administration

  • Severe heart failure

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Flavours of oral liquid formulations may include berry-citrus.

Prepared medicinal forms of LOSARTAN POTASSIUM

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral solution, oral suspension,
Tablet
Oral suspension
